title: Katie Price wades into the Coleen Rooney vs Rebekah Vardy row
text:

Katie Price has waded into the Rebekah Vardy and Coleen Rooney row, saying she thinks Rebekah "must be guilty".

In her latest YouTube video, the former glamour model, 41, argued that Coleen wouldn't have gone public with her claims against Rebekah if she didn't have evidence to prove they were true.

The internet went into meltdown when Coleen, 33, took to Twitter to accuse Jamie Vardy's wife of selling stories on her after lifting them from her private Instagram account.

Rebekah, 37, has vehemently denied the allegations and has hired a team to prove her innocence, but Kate thinks "there must be truth in it".

(Image: Youtube)

(Image: PA)

After reading out Coleen's statement, Katie said: "Oh my god this is a scandal. I can't believe that. Some people have said 'Do you think this is true?'

"Coleen, I've met her at an event, she seems very nice. Rebekah Vardy, I've met Rebekah Vardy a few times.

"I'm just saying, and I'm not taking sides, but Coleen seems a bit like me. You don't say stuff unless you have evidence.

"Anyone I've outed is for a reason if they've really tried to damage me, for example my best friends when they betrayed me with the husband.

(Image: Youtube)

"Of course I'm gonna out them, I'm gonna name and shame them, put their name out there, pictures the lot. Why wouldn't you?"

Katie then said she felt sorry for Rebekah but doesn't understand why she would sell stories on Coleen if she is guilty.

She continued: "I'm sorry to say, it's horrible Rebekah's getting all this s*** and everything like that, but I genuinely believe Coleen would not put this statement out unless she had evidence because she could get done for defamatory.

(Image: Youtube)

"Rebekah's having a baby, she's heavily pregnant. There's no way, there must be truth in it, there's got to be.

"I'm sorry to say that, people can hate me. Do what you like, I'm used to it, troll me. There's got to be truth in it, that is hardcore."

Mirror Online has contacted Rebekah's reps for comment.
description: Katie argued that Coleen wouldn't have gone public with her claims against Rebekah if she didn't have evidence
